9.speaker: Wyll
9.text: Because our relation was no matter of pride, not least for him.
9.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

159.speaker: Wyll
159.text: Because our relation was no matter of pride, not least for him.

11.speaker: Wyll
11.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

28.speaker: Wyll
28.text: 'You can put distance between you and yesterday, but you'll never leave it fully behind.'
28.context:
NodeContext: [Tom P] Pickup:
Has found out his father was abducted. Original felt too melancholy - should be  quoting his father with a sense of nobility

57.speaker: Wyll
57.text: Father's words. Hard to argue with them.
57.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

62.speaker: Wyll
62.text: Florrick spoke true. I'm a Grand Duke's son.
62.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

130.speaker: Player
130.text: Well he's not just any Grand Duke. He's Ulder Ravengard - the most influential duke in the city.
130.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

39.speaker: Karlach
39.text: Well he's not just any Grand Duke. He's Ulder Ravengard - the most influential duke in the city.
39.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Then the choice is clear: we should rescue Duke Ravengard.
3.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

170.speaker: Player
170.text: Then the choice is clear: we should rescue Duke Ravengard.
170.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

19.speaker: Wyll
19.text: Thank you. That means a lot. But I wonder -
19.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: Aren't you worried? Your father's been abducted.
155.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

184.speaker: Wyll
184.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Were you close to your father at all?
50.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

40.speaker: Wyll
40.text: I was close to him once. Until he disowned me and cast me out of Baldur's Gate.
40.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

271.speaker: Wyll
271.text: I can't tell you more - the pact forbids it. My lips are quite literally sealed.
271.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

30.speaker: Wyll
30.text: He made me an exile. That said, I'm not about to let him suffer at the hands of his captors.
30.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: You were disowned? There must be more to the story.
123.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

15.speaker: Wyll
15.text: And there is. I want to tell you but I - I can't. The pact forbids it.

166.speaker: Wyll
166.text: And there is. I would tell you more, but - I can't. That must be the end of it.

144.speaker: Player
144.text: What do you think the drow want with your father?
144.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

178.speaker: Wyll
178.text: I've been asking myself the same question.
178.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

265.speaker: Wyll
265.text: What makes a duke of Baldur's Gate so interesting to the drow? Even the houses of Menzoberranzan would have little use for my father.
265.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

185.speaker: Wyll
185.text: No, this is no drow plot. These Absolute nutters, these 'True Souls', are behind his abduction.
185.context:
NodeContext: MEN-zo-buh-RAN-zin

Has found out his father was abducted.

47.speaker: Wyll
47.text: His absence alone will sow chaos in the city. If they were to infect him -
47.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

230.speaker: Wyll
230.text: - he could lead Baldur's Gate to ruin.
230.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

146.speaker: Wyll
146.text: All the more reason to find him. The Absolute has seized not just my father, but the future of the Sword Coast.
146.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

2.speaker: Wyll
2.text: Whatever the reason, they've seized not just a Grand Duke, but the very future of Baldur's Gate.
2.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

172.speaker: Player
172.text: You shouldn't keep secrets like this from me, Wyll.
172.context: NodeContext: Slightly contrite but only very subtly so. Still strong and not too dramatic.

101.speaker: Wyll
101.context: NodeContext: Slightly contrite but only very subtly so. Still strong and not too dramatic.

248.speaker: Wyll
248.text: My story is one of two men.
248.context: NodeContext: Slightly contrite but only very subtly so. Still strong and not too dramatic.

36.speaker: Wyll
36.text: The Blade of Frontiers. A man hunting the fiends who prey on the weak and claw at the Coast.
36.context: NodeContext: Slightly contrite but only very subtly so. Still strong and not too dramatic.

26.speaker: Wyll
26.text: And Wyll Ravengard. A memory of a memory. A man who belongs to the past.
26.context: NodeContext: Slightly contrite but only very subtly so. Still strong and not too dramatic.

78.speaker: Wyll
78.text: I wanted you to know the Blade, not the shadow he left behind.
78.context: NodeContext: Slightly contrite but only very subtly so. Still strong and not too dramatic.

97.speaker: Wyll
97.text: When I look into a mirror, I see two faces.
97.context: NodeContext: Slightly contrite but only very subtly so. Still strong and not too dramatic.

16.speaker: Wyll
16.text: I see the Blade of Frontiers. A man hunting the fiends who prey on the weak and claw at the Coast.
16.context: NodeContext: Slightly contrite but only very subtly so. Still strong and not too dramatic.

272.speaker: Wyll
272.text: And I see Wyll Ravengard. A memory of a memory. A man who belongs to the past.
272.context: NodeContext: Slightly contrite but only very subtly so. Still strong and not too dramatic.

254.speaker: Player
254.text: I can't trust you if you keep secrets like this.

210.speaker: Player
210.text: I can't trust you if you keep so many secrets. First Mizora, now this.

202.speaker: Player
202.text: So? I'm not interested in your lineage.

142.speaker: Wyll
142.text: Ignore my past all you want. But my past is not about to ignore me.

212.speaker: Wyll
212.text: Put plainly, I'm not about to let these drow go unpunished for taking my father.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: Curious. I'd heard Duke Ravengard's son left the city.

226.speaker: Player
226.text: All my time in Baldur's Gate, and I didn't even know Ravengard had children.

21.speaker: Wyll
21.text: My father and I were close, once upon a time. Until he disowned me and cast me out of Baldur's Gate.

63.speaker: Wyll
63.text: Such a rift isn't so easily mended. But it's not so wide that I'd let my own father suffer at his captor's hands.

196.speaker: Player
196.text: Not just a grand duke - Ravengard has more power and influence than anyone.

156.speaker: Astarion
156.text: Not just a grand duke - Ravengard has more power and influence than anyone.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Not just any Grand Duke - the most influential in the city, if my memory serves me right. And for once, I think it does.

68.speaker: Shadowheart
68.text: Not just any Grand Duke - the most influential in the city, if my memory serves me right. And for once, I think it does.

99.speaker: Wyll
99.text: Dammit it all to the Hells. We left Waukeen's Rest to burn - and Grand Duke Ravengard to burn along with it.
99.context: NodeContext: Player left behind a burning inn that Wyll's father could have been in.

274.speaker: Wyll
274.context: NodeContext: Player left behind a burning inn that Wyll's father could have been in.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Hells, you're right. Should we go back?
58.context: NodeContext: Player left behind a burning inn that Wyll's father could have been in.

12.speaker: Wyll
12.text: The inn has long burned to the ground. We'd more easily pull a rainbow from the sky.
12.context: NodeContext: Player left behind a burning inn that Wyll's father could have been in.

261.speaker: Wyll
261.text: You need to understand - Duke Ravengard is my father.
261.context: NodeContext: Player left behind a burning inn that Wyll's father could have been in.

268.speaker: Player
268.text: Why so upset? Do you know the duke personally?
268.context: NodeContext: Player left behind a burning inn that Wyll's father could have been in.

241.speaker: Wyll
241.text: In a manner of speaking. Duke Ravengard is my father.
241.context: NodeContext: Player left behind a burning inn that Wyll's father could have been in.

195.speaker: Player
195.text: And why didn't you tell me this before?
195.context: NodeContext: Player left behind a burning inn that Wyll's father could have been in.

48.speaker: Wyll
48.text: Because our relation was no matter of pride, not least for him.
48.context: NodeContext: Player left behind a burning inn that Wyll's father could have been in.

192.speaker: Wyll
192.text: I was close to my father once. Until he disowned me and cast me out of Baldur's Gate.
192.context: NodeContext: Player left behind a burning inn that Wyll's father could have been in.

175.speaker: Wyll
175.text: Hells. He may have made me an exile. But my heart aches to think we abandoned him to the flames.
175.context: NodeContext: Player left behind a burning inn that Wyll's father could have been in.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: I am so sorry, Wyll. I should've done more.
70.context: NodeContext: Player left behind a burning inn that Wyll's father could have been in.

187.speaker: Wyll
187.text: You weren't to know. I should have said sooner, but it's a complicated matter.
187.context: NodeContext: Player left behind a burning inn that Wyll's father could have been in.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Was your father, more like. He's surely been toasted by now.
33.context: NodeContext: Player left behind a burning inn that Wyll's father could have been in.

238.speaker: Wyll
238.text: My heart aches to think of it.
238.context: NodeContext: Player left behind a burning inn that Wyll's father could have been in.

119.speaker: Player
119.context: NodeContext: Player left behind a burning inn that Wyll's father could have been in.

225.speaker: Wyll
225.text: I should have said sooner, I know. But it's a complicated matter.
225.context: NodeContext: Player left behind a burning inn that Wyll's father could have been in.

162.speaker: Wyll
162.text: Hells. He may have made me an exile. But he didn't deserve to be abandoned to the flames.
162.context: NodeContext: Player left behind a burning inn that Wyll's father could have been in.

181.speaker: Wyll
181.text: No - this can't be his end. Father's vanquished dragon cultists and assassins alike with his own bastard sword. A Ravengard is not ruined by fire nor blood.
181.context: NodeContext: Player left behind a burning inn that Wyll's father could have been in.

234.speaker: Wyll
234.context: NodeContext: Player left behind a burning inn that Wyll's father could have been in.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: There must be more to this 'disownment' story.

179.speaker: Wyll
179.text: There is. And you know why I can't tell you. My lips are quite literally sealed.

157.speaker: Player
157.text: You were disowned? There must be more to the story.

52.speaker: Wyll
52.text: There is. But I can't tell you more - the pact forbids it.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: If I'm to trust you, you need to be honest with me. About everything.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: If your father's still out there, we'll find him.

5.speaker: Wyll
5.text: Courage and confidence. You would have made a fine child to my father.

29.speaker: Wyll
29.text: Me, well - I've never been able to escape my father's name, try as I might.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: What was it like, being the son of a Grand Duke?

193.speaker: Player
193.text: Buildings burn, dukes die. We've got more pressing concerns.

100.speaker: Narrator
100.text: *Wyll's mind bonds with yours. In your memory, he sees Waukeen's Rest burning - and hears that Grand Duke Ravengard may be trapped inside.*
100.context: NodeContext: Player left behind a burning inn that Wyll's father could have been in.

177.speaker: Wyll
177.text: Dammit it all to the Hells. You left Waukeen's Rest to burn - and Grand Duke Ravengard to burn along with it.
177.context: NodeContext: Player left behind a burning inn that Wyll's father could have been in.

54.speaker: Wyll
54.text: You need to understand - Duke Ravengard is my father.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: All the more pressing reason to rescue him from Moonrise Towers.

222.speaker: Wyll
222.text: I was close to my father once. Until he disowned me and cast me out of Baldur's Gate.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: And why didn't you tell me this before?

251.speaker: Wyll
251.text: Because our relation was no matter of pride, not least for him.

118.speaker: Player
118.text: Really, now? I wouldn't have guessed you're from noble stock.

188.speaker: Wyll
188.text: Hardy stock, perhaps. But father was born to a labourer, not an aristocrat.

59.speaker: Wyll
59.text: I was close to him once. Until he disowned me and cast me out of Baldur's Gate.

18.speaker: Wyll
18.text: But my heart still aches to think he's been taken by these... cultists.

262.speaker: Wyll
262.text: That name - 'Gortash'. I know of him. A so-called 'military advisor' to the Baldur's Gate elite. A weapons dealer, in cruder terms.

218.speaker: Wyll
218.text: We must rescue father from Moonrise. He is a powerful man - the most beloved duke in Baldur's Gate.

160.speaker: Wyll
160.text: Should the Absolute cultists infect him, there's no telling the damage he might do when he's returned to the city.

260.speaker: Player
260.text: We'll retrieve your father from Moonrise.

114.speaker: Wyll
114.text: I should've said sooner, I know - but it's a complicated matter.

132.speaker: Wyll
132.text: Not so enchanting as you'd think. The Portyrs, the Caldwells - they were the bluebloods hosting the fancy balls and drinking from gold goblets.

4.speaker: Wyll
4.text: Not so enchanting as you'd think. The Portyrs, the Caldwells - they were the bluebloods hosting the fancy balls and drinking from gold goblets.

7.speaker: Wyll
7.text: Father's the son of a blacksmith, born with barely a coin in the coffers.

127.speaker: Wyll
127.text: He made a name for himself among the Flaming Fist. Brave as Balduran, stubborn as a deep rothé. Daring, outspoken - but hardly posh.

66.speaker: Wyll
66.text: I spent more time duelling with father than I did rubbing elbows with lords.

106.speaker: Wyll
106.text: Not to say I didn't develop a taste for good wine and a talent for courtly dance.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Courtly dance? I'd love to see a demonstration.

242.speaker: Wyll
242.text: Ahem. It's been a badger's age since I've twinkled my toes. A drunk ogre could put on a better show.

219.speaker: Wyll
219.text: Tempting. Give it some time, develop a bond, and - maybe I'll show you a move or two.

154.speaker: Player
154.text: You dance like a drunk ogre? That sounds hilarious. Count me in!

259.speaker: Wyll
259.text: Ha! Well, give it some time, develop a bond, and - maybe I'll show you a move or two.

201.speaker: Wyll
201.text: I promise, 'clumsy oaf' is well within my repertoire.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: I get the idea. Well, I won't press the issue.

85.speaker: Wyll
85.text: It's for the best. I take a tumble, and splat - there goes my good eye!

227.speaker: Player
227.text: And now you're the Blade of Frontiers. Quite a change, don't you think?

111.speaker: Wyll
111.text: Father taught me the four pillars of power. Courage. Insight. Strategy. Justice.

183.speaker: Wyll
183.text: He reckoned I'd follow in his footsteps - first as a Fist Marshal, then as a duke. Vanquish evil, maintain order, save the world.

138.speaker: Wyll
138.text: But a duke makes bedfellows with more monsters than he slays. Father called it 'diplomacy'. I called it 'hypocrisy'.

164.speaker: Wyll
164.text: In the frontiers, there is no posturing, no diplomacy. I slay monsters, I don't consort with them.

276.speaker: Wyll
276.text: Even if I might look like one.

197.speaker: Wyll
197.text: Well - not when I can avoid it.

257.speaker: Player
257.text: Good wine? I'll toast to that.

131.speaker: Wyll
131.text: Hear, hear! Though truth be told, I'd sooner down a week-old hooch at a ramshackle inn.

80.speaker: Wyll
80.text: Better company. And a better buzz.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: I shouldn't be surprised. I find you a bit smug, to be honest.

256.speaker: Wyll
256.text: I suppose the acorn didn't fall far from the tree. The sins of the father live with the son, eh?

76.speaker: Wyll
76.text: But I gained his virtues, too. Courage. Insight. A just heart. A strategic mind.

239.speaker: Wyll
239.text: I like to think I did, anyway. I'll have to let you be the judge.

148.speaker: Wyll
148.text: Hells - father's been taken to Moonrise?

174.speaker: Wyll
174.text: First a parasite prods at our heads. Then the shadows close in. More than ever, we need each other's trust.

269.speaker: Wyll
269.text: First a parasite prods at our heads. Then the shadows close in. More than ever, we need each other's trust.

93.speaker: Wyll
93.text: And I fear I've been less than honest.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: It takes time to establish trust. I understand that.

216.speaker: Wyll
216.text: You're incredibly kind. But you earned the right to hear this long ago.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Well, out with it then. What's on your mind?

247.speaker: Wyll
247.text: The man I call my father. More precisely, Grand Duke Ravengard of Baldur's Gate.

51.speaker: Narrator
51.text: *Grand Duke Ravengard, one of Baldur's Gate's most influential and beloved figures. Every Baldurian knows his name.*

116.speaker: Player
116.text: Ravengard. He's been a legend since I was a wee one. No one loves Baldur's Gate more than him.

203.speaker: Karlach
203.text: Ravengard. He's been a legend since I was a wee one. No one loves Baldur's Gate more than him.

249.speaker: Player
249.text: I should've said sooner. But our relation was no matter of pride, not least for him.

13.speaker: Wyll
13.text: I should've said sooner. But our relation was no matter of pride, not least for him.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: 'Grand Duke?' A powerful man from the sounds of it.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: First Mizora, now this? You've been keeping too many secrets.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: You were disowned? There must be more to the story.

0.speaker: Wyll
0.text: There is. But my pact forbids me from telling it. I'm sorry.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Your father must be a powerful man indeed, to be called Grand Duke.

41.speaker: Wyll
41.text: And a treasured one. Under his command, the Flaming Fist mercenary company has thwarted countless threats against Baldur's Gate.

209.speaker: Wyll
209.text: He is the force that holds the city together. Without him, the winds alone might be enough to raze it.

215.speaker: Wyll
215.text: You still deserved to know. There is more to me than infernal power and pacts.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: You shouldn't keep secrets like this from me, Wyll.

221.speaker: Player
221.text: I don't get the sense that you're very close to your father.

224.speaker: Wyll
224.text: My father and I were close, once upon a time. Until he disowned me and cast me out of Baldur's Gate.

110.speaker: Wyll
110.text: The inevitable consequence of inseparable events.

140.speaker: Player
140.text: What was it like, being the son of a Grand Duke?

200.speaker: Player
200.text: 'No matter of pride'? Are the two of you not close?

122.speaker: Player
122.text: Curious. I'd heard Duke Ravengard's son left the city.

153.speaker: Player
153.text: I didn't know Ravengard had any children.

211.speaker: Player
211.text: You're Ravengard's pup? The Ravengard? Well, that is something...

88.speaker: Astarion
88.text: You're Ravengard's pup? The Ravengard? Well, that is something...

240.speaker: Player
240.text: Ravengard? Never met him, but quite popular on the street, as far as aristocrats go.

194.speaker: Shadowheart
194.text: Ravengard? Never met him, but quite popular on the street, as far as aristocrats go.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: Mizora's pup has been keeping secrets? Am I supposed to be surprised?

67.speaker: Wyll
67.text: Not a secret so much as... an omission.

270.speaker: Wyll
270.text: The man I call father is Ulder Ravengard, a Grand Duke of Baldur's Gate.

252.speaker: Narrator
252.text: *Wyll's brows furrow as your minds connect. He sees the burning embers of Waukeen's rest, then Florrick's face as she tells you of Ravengard's abduction.*

149.speaker: Player
149.text: Yes - drow set fire to the inn and stole away with the duke.
149.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

103.speaker: Wyll
103.text: Then we need to seek him out and get him to safety. You see - Grand Duke Ravengard is my father.
103.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: You must know the man, judging by the concern in your voice.
34.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

83.speaker: Wyll
83.text: I know him better than most. He's my father.
83.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

232.speaker: Wyll
232.text: I know I haven't said. Our relation was no matter of pride, not least for him.
232.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: Counsellor Florrick seems to think so. I'm not so sure he wasn't burned in that blaze.
180.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.

167.speaker: Wyll
167.text: If Florrick says he lives, then he lives, and we need to free him from his captors. You see - Grand Duke Ravengard is my father.
167.context: NodeContext: Has found out his father was abducted.
